results.title: Don't tell me I can't
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Krystyna Popczyk
results.brief_description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.

results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Gregory and Sejong Park
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.

results.title: Tom Olsson's Cohuna
results.brief_description: Cohuna - When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector in 1952, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting film give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950’s Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward.

results.title: Olympic Games, Melbourne, Australia, 1956
results.brief_description: The 1956 Olympics warranted the Straford Brothers using their cherished stock of coloured film to capture this unique event. Original footage of the Athletics field (notably pole vaulting), swimming and diving events in the pool have been compiled by Frank years later with additional video content and a voiceover. Despite shooting some of this additional footage on his living room floor (inadvertantly including a glimpse of shagpile carpet) and such ‘special effects’ as a whiteboard marker illustrating points on a map, the documentary has a lot of interesting detail about the event; about their personal experience of it and the novelty of seeing OB Television crews in action.

results.title: World to conquer
results.brief_description: This sci-fi ‘Straford Brothers Specialite’ is a scripted drama featuring local student actors. A classic sci-fi set up, it has some nifty DIY special effects including painstakingly made miniature sets (watch out for the alien control room!), animated spaceship and a alien periscope very reminiscent of early ‘Doctor Who’ episodes.

group_siblings.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box

results.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box
results.brief_description:
Beautifully drawn and coloured animation ponders human existence - the misery and fleetingness of life and its solace, hope.
This work was produced as part of AIM (Centre for Animation and interactive Media), RMIT, 2003.

results.title: Shopper
results.brief_description: The CCTV cameras at this late-night supermarket belie the dissatisfaction and boredom that exists within as one store attendant fights to stay sane and survive his shift.
